channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Policy relief for family caregivers seems stalled out. But there are signs of change
item.description: Family members carry the burden and costs of caring for America's aging population. Federal policy change is slow to come but a new movement and state...

item.title: Thousands watch livestream of Maine family's food pantry for deer
item.description: A three-generation family in Maine set up a camera to capture their deer-feeding station. Thousands watch online as hundreds of white-tailed deer enjo...

item.title: Federal appeals court judge is accused of bullying her clerks
item.description: The Legal Accountability Project complaint, which has not been previously reported, states that it is based on conversations with multiple former law ...

item.title: China flexes blockade capabilities near Taiwan on second day of military drills
item.description: China's People's Liberation Army is staging a second day of large-scale military drills around Taiwan. It's unleashing live-fire exercises as part of ...

item.title: Trump, Netanyahu meet over ceasefire. And, Russia accuses Ukraine of attempted strike
item.description: Conditions are dire for people in Gaza as President Trump and Israel's prime minister discuss the next phase of the ceasefire deal. And, Russia accuse...

item.title: Winter storm packing snow and strong winds to descend on Great Lakes and Northeast
item.description: A wild winter storm is bringing strong winds, heavy snow and frigid temperatures to the Great Lakes and Northeast.

item.title: Trump confirms Venezuela land strike, U.S. strikes another alleged drug boat in the Pacific
item.description: President Trump confirmed the first known land strike inside Venezuela as news of another strike against an alleged drug-carrying vessel in the Pacifi...

item.title: Ukraine denies drone attack on Putin's residence
item.description: Russia has accused Ukraine of targeting a presidential residence, which President Zelensky called "typical Russian lies".

item.title: Trump says U.S. hit "big facility" linked to alleged drug boats
item.description: President Trump said the U.S. hit a "big facility" last week linked to alleged drug boat operations, as tensions ratchet up with Venezuela.

item.title: Trump's stern warning for Iran on nuclear weapons: "Consequences will be very powerful"
item.description: President Trump commented on Iran's nuclear weapons program during his press conference with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. CBS News' Ed O...

item.title: Eurostar disruption to continue after power outage in Channel Tunnel
item.description: Eurostar services will resume with severe delays and possible cancellations after services were suspended due to a power supply problem.

item.title: Powerful winter storms pummel the Northeast with heavy snow and strong winds
item.description: Parts of the Northeast are facing hurricane-force winds and heavy snow. CBS News' Ian Lee reports, and Rob Marciano has the latest weather forecast.

item.title: K-pop band member sued for $30m after bitter record label feud
item.description: Record label Ador says it has dropped NewJeans member Danielle Marsh while the return of Minji remains uncertain.

item.title: Guinea junta chief takes lead in controversial election as social media restricted
item.description: TikTok, YouTube and Facebook are down, as the nation awaits the final result from the presidential poll.

item.title: Alleged D.C. pipe bomber appearing in court to contest continued detention
item.description: Brian Cole was arrested and charged earlier this month for allegedly planting two pipe bombs outside the Republican and Democratic Party headquarters ...

item.title: Saudi Arabia backs call for UAE to leave Yemen after strike on separatist-held port
item.description: The UAE denies Saudi claims it sent a shipment of weapons to separatists and pushed them to launch offensives against the Yemeni government.

item.title: Court releases transcript from closed hearing for man accused of killing Charlie Kirk
2 New Jersey pilots killed in a helicopter collision frequented a cafe together near the crash site
